intro: Lychnis behen, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and features small, pink to white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit, with numerous stems arising from a central rootstock. Its leaves are usually opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Lychnis behen thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or dry meadows.
